On observe aussi des activitÃ©s intÃ©ressantes concernant l'optimisation potentielle des composants Text et View. Canvaskit-js permet d'exÃ©cuter Skia sur le web pour seulement 20kb !

segments.source_content: [**highlight.io**](http://highlight.io)Â is a truly open-source application monitoring solution. They support Session Replay, Error Monitoring, and Logging platform; a perfect solution for your next project.

segments.source_content: Don't waste time trying to guess why a bug happens. Use highlight and get a clear picture of your browser and server-side application.

segments.source_content: Google's Web Components framework [Lit has just been released in v3.0](https://lit.dev/blog/2023-10-10-lit-3.0/). In addition to improvements to the framework (decorators, template compiler, Preact Signals), there is in particular the `@lit/react` integration package, which has graduated from the Lab, is now stable and in v1.0.

translations.fr: Le framework Web Components de Google [Lit vient d'Ãªtre publiÃ© en v3.0](https://lit.dev/blog/2023-10-10-lit-3.0/). Outre des amÃ©liorations du framework (dÃ©corateurs, compilateur de templates, Preact Signals), on note particuliÃ¨rement le package d'intÃ©gration `@lit/react`, dÃ©sormais stable en v1.0.
translations.en: Le framework Web Components de Google [Lit vient d'Ãªtre publiÃ© en v3.0](https://lit.dev/blog/2023-10-10-lit-3.0/). En plus d'amÃ©liorations du framework (dÃ©corateurs, compilateur de templates, Preact Signals), on trouve notamment le package d'intÃ©gration `@lit/react` qui a quittÃ© le Lab, est dÃ©sormais stable et en v1.0.
translations.zh-hans: Google çš„ Web Components æ¡†æ¶ [Lit åˆšå‘å¸ƒäº† v3.0](https://lit.dev/blog/2023-10-10-lit-3.0/)ã€‚é™¤äº†æ¡†æ¶æœ¬èº«çš„æ”¹è¿›ï¼ˆè£…é¥°å™¨ã€æ¨¡æ¿ç¼–è¯‘å™¨ã€Preact Signalsï¼‰å¤–ï¼Œç‰¹åˆ«å€¼å¾—ä¸€æçš„æ˜¯ `@lit/react` é›†æˆåŒ…å·²ä»å®éªŒå®¤æ¯•ä¸šï¼Œç°åœ¨ç¨³å®šå¤„äº v1.0ã€‚

segments.source_content: This integration facilitates the use of Web Components in a React app (or Preact) by creating a wrapper that maps React props to the properties of the custom element, manages event handlers and facilitates TypeScript typing. It fills certain gaps in React 18, which does not integrate easily with Web Components: props are mapped to attributes rather than properties. See the [documentation for the React framework](https://lit.dev/docs/frameworks/react/).

translations.fr: Cette intÃ©gration facilite l'utilisation des Web Components dans une app React (ou Preact) en crÃ©ant un wrapper qui mappe les props React vers les propriÃ©tÃ©s du custom element, gÃ¨re les gestionnaires d'Ã©vÃ©nements et facilite le typage TypeScript. Elle comble certaines lacunes de React 18 qui n'intÃ¨gre pas facilement les Web Components : les props sont mappÃ©s en attributs plutÃ´t qu'en propriÃ©tÃ©s. Voir la [documentation pour le framework React](https://lit.dev/docs/frameworks/react/).
translations.en: Cette intÃ©gration facilite l'utilisation des Web Components dans une app React (ou Preact) en crÃ©ant un wrapper qui mappe les props React aux propriÃ©tÃ©s du custom element, gÃ¨re les gestionnaires d'Ã©vÃ©nements et facilite le typage TypeScript. Elle comble certaines lacunes de React 18 qui n'intÃ¨gre pas facilement les Web Components : les props sont mappÃ©es vers des attributs plutÃ´t que des propriÃ©tÃ©s. Voir la [documentation pour le framework React](https://lit.dev/docs/frameworks/react/).

segments.source_content: But can a modern React dev use all this easily? Lit offers experimental packages [@lit-labs/ssr](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr), [@lit-labs/ssr-react](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr-react) and [@lit-labs/nextjs](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/nextjs) but support is limited and won't work with Next.js App Router. The [Declarative Shadow DOM](https://developer.chrome.com/articles/declarative-shadow-dom/), which allows SSR, is not yet implemented in Firefox, but a polyfill exists. In short, Lit should work well on a CRA app, but still feels a bit risky if you need SSR and SEO.

translations.fr: Mais un dÃ©veloppeur React moderne peut-il utiliser tout cela facilement ? Lit propose des packages expÃ©rimentaux [@lit-labs/ssr](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr), [@lit-labs/ssr-react](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr-react) et [@lit-labs/nextjs](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/nextjs) mais le support est limitÃ© et ne fonctionne pas avec Next.js App Router. Le [Declarative Shadow DOM](https://developer.chrome.com/articles/declarative-shadow-dom/) permettant le SSR n'est pas encore implÃ©mentÃ© dans Firefox, mais un polyfill existe. En bref, Lit devrait bien fonctionner sur une app CRA, mais reste un peu risquÃ© si vous avez besoin de SSR et SEO.
translations.en: Mais un dÃ©veloppeur React moderne peut-il utiliser tout cela facilement ? Lit propose des packages expÃ©rimentaux [@lit-labs/ssr](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr), [@lit-labs/ssr-react](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr-react) et [@lit-labs/nextjs](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/nextjs) mais le support est limitÃ© et ne fonctionnera pas avec Next.js App Router. Le [Shadow DOM dÃ©claratif](https://developer.chrome.com/articles/declarative-shadow-dom/), qui permet le SSR, n'est pas encore implÃ©mentÃ© dans Firefox, mais un polyfill existe. Bref, Lit devrait bien fonctionner sur une app CRA, mais semble encore un peu risquÃ© si vous avez besoin de SSR et SEO.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Create collaborative applications like Figma and Miro in a few lines of code with Ably's in-app collaboration SDK](https://hubs.la/Q023nqgg0)
- ğŸ‘€ [Remix PR - Add experimental Vite support](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/pull/7590)
- ğŸ‘€ [Remix PR - Add startViewTransition support](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/pull/10916)
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR - Document Server Actions `.bind` method](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/56164): the [Next.js doc](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/functions/server-actions#binding-arguments) now recommends using `myAction.bind(null, myArg)` to pass additional arguments to a Server Action. The returned function will then also be a Server Action.
- ğŸ“œ [UI Composition - AKA taking a step back to take a step forward](https://kyleshevlin.com/ui-composition): article presenting an example of a Card component that has too much responsibility. Suggests splitting it and using composition to make it more maintainable.
- ğŸ“œ [Server-side pagination with Remix](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/remix-pagination): I found this implementation very interesting, with no `onClick` listener or JS to manipulate the query string. It relies solely on the native behaviour of forms and is therefore compatible with progressive enhancement. My reservation: impossible to open a page in a new tab ğŸ˜….
- ğŸ“œ [Access the Loader Data in Remix](https://sergiodxa.com/tutorials/access-loaders-data-in-remix): presents different ways of using `useLoaderData` or `useRouteLoaderData` and their tradeoffs, depending on where they are used.
- ğŸ“œ [Why I love Remix, And why you should too](https://alemtuzlak.hashnode.dev/why-i-love-remix)
- ğŸ“œ [Making React Apps Memory Efficient - Million.js Beyond Speed](https://dev.to/ricardonunezio/millionjs-beyond-speed-making-react-apps-memory-efficient-2amn)
- ğŸ“œ [Test your React Libraries Locally with Yalc](https://www.propelauth.com/post/test-your-react-libraries-with-yalc)
- ğŸ“œ [Why we still use React HOCs](https://www.propelauth.com/post/why-we-have-both-react-hooks-and-hocs)
- ğŸ“œ [Progressively Enhanced WebGL Lens Refraction](https://tympanus.net/codrops/2023/10/10/progressively-enhanced-webgl-lens-refraction/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Fresh v1.5 - Partials, client side navigation and more](https://deno.com/blog/fresh-1.5): the Preact framework implements client-side navigation based on "Partials", which permits to preserve some state during navigation. View Transitions support is on the way.
- ğŸ“¦ [next-safe-action v4 - Typesafe Server Actions in your Next.js 13 app](https://next-safe-action.dev/): input validation with Zod. Note: a similar project [Zact](https://github.com/pingdotgg/zact) is deprecated in favour of `next-safe-action`.
- ğŸ“¦ [Astro Starlight v0.11](https://github.com/withastro/starlight/releases/tag/%40astrojs%2Fstarlight%400.11.0): adds support for [component overrides](https://starlight.astro.build/guides/overriding-components/) to customize docs.
- ğŸ“¦ [React-Query 5.0.0 RC.10](https://github.com/TanStack/query/releases/tag/v5.0.0-rc.10): the latest RCs bring significant improvements to [ğŸ¦ devtools](https://twitter.com/TkDodo/status/1711297673934848388) and [ğŸ¦ TypeScript](https://twitter.com/TkDodo/status/1711635656642855297).
- ğŸ”— [ServerComponents.dev](https://servercomponents.dev/): a fun interactive resource to find out more about Server Components.
- ğŸ¥ [What's new in Remotion â€“ September 2023](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ol-571DOPDY)
- ğŸ“… [React Jam - October 19-29th - React devs create and play games in 10 days](https://reactjam.com/)
- ğŸ‘¥ [React Advanced](https://reactadvanced.com/?utm_source=email&utm_medium=thisweekinreact) (London ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§, Octobre 20-23) is offering us [\-10% - code "REACT10"](https://ti.to/gitnation/react-advanced-london-2023/discount/REACT10)

segments.source_content: At the moment, React-Native devs are talking a lot [on Twitter](https://twitter.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1707762822015267219) about the perf of the `Text` and `View` components, which are JS wrappers and add overhead compared to the respective native `RCTText` and `RCTView` elements. William Candillon had already ğŸ¥ [explained this problem](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1D78Tc46Xqo&t=1156s) in 2021, with the possibility of optimising Text rendering. It is possible to optimize as long as you don't need a few features like `onPress` listeners. This article presents a benchmark and measures the impact of using the native components instead of regular components, and reports a gain of around 15%, with variations depending on the platform and architecture.

translations.fr: Actuellement, les dÃ©veloppeurs React-Native discutent beaucoup [sur Twitter](https://twitter.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1707762822015267219) des performances des composants `Text` et `View`, qui sont des wrappers JS ajoutant une surcharge comparÃ© aux Ã©lÃ©ments natifs `RCTText` et `RCTView`. William Candillon avait dÃ©jÃ  ğŸ¥ [expliquÃ© ce problÃ¨me](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1D78Tc46Xqo&t=1156s) en 2021, Ã©voquant la possibilitÃ© d'optimiser le rendu du texte. Cette optimisation est possible tant qu'on n'a pas besoin de fonctionnalitÃ©s comme les Ã©couteurs `onPress`. Cet article prÃ©sente un benchmark mesurant l'impact de l'utilisation des composants natifs, rapportant un gain d'environ 15%, avec des variations selon la plateforme et l'architecture.
translations.en: Actuellement, les dÃ©veloppeurs React-Native discutent beaucoup [sur Twitter](https://twitter.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1707762822015267219) des performances des composants `Text` et `View`, qui sont des wrappers JS ajoutant une surcharge par rapport aux Ã©lÃ©ments natifs `RCTText` et `RCTView`. William Candillon avait dÃ©jÃ  ğŸ¥ [expliquÃ© ce problÃ¨me](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1D78Tc46Xqo&t=1156s) en 2021, Ã©voquant l'optimisation possible du rendu texte. Cette optimisation est rÃ©alisable tant que certaines fonctionnalitÃ©s comme les Ã©couteurs `onPress` ne sont pas nÃ©cessaires. L'article prÃ©sente un benchmark mesurant l'impact des composants natifs versus rÃ©guliers, rapportant un gain d'environ 15%, avec des variations selon la plateforme et l'architecture.
translations.zh-hans: ç›®å‰ï¼ŒReact Native å¼€å‘è€…æ­£åœ¨[Twitter](https://twitter.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1707762822015267219)ä¸Šçƒ­è®® `Text` å’Œ `View` ç»„ä»¶çš„æ€§èƒ½é—®é¢˜ã€‚è¿™äº› JavaScript åŒ…è£…å™¨ç›¸æ¯”åŸç”Ÿ `RCTText` å’Œ `RCTView` å…ƒç´ ä¼šå¢åŠ å¼€é”€ã€‚William Candillon æ—©åœ¨ 2021 å¹´å°±é€šè¿‡ğŸ¥[è§†é¢‘è§£é‡Šè¿‡æ­¤é—®é¢˜](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1D78Tc46Xqo&t=1156s)ï¼Œå¹¶æå‡ºäº†ä¼˜åŒ–æ–‡æœ¬æ¸²æŸ“çš„å¯èƒ½æ€§ã€‚åªè¦ä¸éœ€è¦ `onPress` ç›‘å¬å™¨ç­‰å°‘æ•°åŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œå³å¯å®ç°ä¼˜åŒ–ã€‚æœ¬æ–‡é€šè¿‡åŸºå‡†æµ‹è¯•è¡¡é‡äº†ä½¿ç”¨åŸç”Ÿç»„ä»¶æ›¿ä»£å¸¸è§„ç»„ä»¶çš„å½±å“ï¼Œç»“æœæ˜¾ç¤ºæ€§èƒ½æå‡çº¦ 15%ï¼Œå…·ä½“æ•ˆæœå› å¹³å°å’Œæ¶æ„è€Œå¼‚ã€‚

segments.source_content: Now that this trick became mainstream, React-Native devs are keen to take advantage of it. We can note the creation of [react-native-fast-text](https://github.com/peterpme/react-native-fast-text), or the POC of a Babel plugin [react-native-optimizer](https://github.com/marklawlor/react-native-optimizer) which would apply this optimisation automatically.

translations.fr: Maintenant que cette technique se gÃ©nÃ©ralise, les dÃ©veloppeurs cherchent Ã  en profiter. On note la crÃ©ation de [react-native-fast-text](https://github.com/peterpme/react-native-fast-text) ou le POC d'un plugin Babel [react-native-optimizer](https://github.com/marklawlor/react-native-optimizer) qui appliquerait automatiquement cette optimisation.
translations.en: Cette technique devenant mainstream, les dÃ©veloppeurs React-Native cherchent Ã  en profiter. On note la crÃ©ation de [react-native-fast-text](https://github.com/peterpme/react-native-fast-text) ou le POC d'un plugin Babel [react-native-optimizer](https://github.com/marklawlor/react-native-optimizer) appliquant automatiquement cette optimisation.

You can use ADB or Maestro commands to simulate scrolling.
